cards:
The Fool
beginnings possibilities, pleasure, thoughtlessness, adventure, opportunity
Flipped meaning: indecision, hesitation, injustice, apathy, bad choice

The Magician
creativity, self-confidence, dexterity, sleight of hand,will-power, skill
Flipped meaning: delay, unimaginative, insecurity, lack of self-confidence

The High Priestess
knowledge, wisdom, learning, intuition, impatience, virtue, purity
Flipped meaning: selfishness, shallowness, misunderstanding, ignorance

The Empress
development, accomplishment action, evolution
Flipped meaning: inaction, lack on concentration, vacillation, anxiety, infidelity

The Emperor
authority, father-figure, structure, solid foundation
Flipped meaning: domination, excessive control, rigidity, inflexibility

The Hierophant
mercy, conformity, forgiveness, social approval, bonded, inspiration
Flipped meaning: vulnerability, unconventionality, foolish generosity, impotence, frailty, unorthodoxy

The Lovers
harmony, trust, romance, optimism, honor, love, harmony
Flipped meaning: separation, frustration, unreliability, fickleness, untrustworthy

The Chariot
perseverance, rushed decision, turmoil, vengeance, adversity
Flipped meaning: vanquishment, defeat, failure, unsuccessful

Strength
courage, conviction, strength, determination, action, heroism, virility
Flipped meaning: pettiness, sickness, unfaithfulness, weakness

The Hermit
inner strength, prudence, withdrawal, caution, vigilance
Flipped meaning: hastiness, rashness, immaturity, imprudence, foolishness

The Wheel of Fortune
unexpected events, advancement, destiny, fortune, progress
Flipped meaning: interruption, outside influences, failure, bad luck

Justice
equality, righteousness, virtue, honor, harmony, balance
Flipped meaning: alse accusation, unfairness, abuse, biased

The Hanged Man
change, reversal, boredom, improvement, rebirth, suspension, change
Flipped meaning: false prophecy, useless sacrifice, unwillingness

Death
unexpected change, loss, failure, transformation, death, bad luck
Flipped meaning: immobility, slow changes, cheating, death, stagnation

Temperance
emperance, patience, good influence, confidence, moderation
Flipped meaning: conflict, disunion, frustration, impatience, discord

The Devil
downfall, unexpected failure, controversy, ravage, disaster, ill tempered
Flipped meaning: release, enlightenment, divorce, recovery

The Tower
disruption, abandonment, end of friendship, bankruptcy, downfall, unexpected events
Flipped meaning: entrapment, imprisonment, old ways, rustic

The Star
balance, pleasure, optimism, insight, spiritual love, hope, faith
Flipped meaning: disappointment, bad luck, imbalance, broken dreams

The Moon
double-dealing Deception, disillusionment, trickery, error, danger, disgrace
Flipped meaning: trifling mistakes, deception discovered, negative advantage

The Sun
accomplishment, success, love, joy, happy marriage, satisfaction
Flipped meaning: loneliness, canceled plans, unhappiness, break ups

Judgement or Rejuvenation
awakening, renewal, rejuvenation, rebirth, improvement, promotion, atonement, judgment
Flipped meaning: disappointment, indecision, death, failure, ill-health, theft, worry

The World
perfection, recognition, success, fulfillment, eternal life
Flipped meaning: lack of vision, disappointment, imperfection

Ace of Wands
profitable journey, new business, beginning, new career, birth, inheritance
Flipped meaning: selfishness, lack of determination, setback

Two of Wands
generous person, courage, patience, courage
Flipped meaning: impatience, domination

Three of Wands
cooperation, good partnership, success
Flipped meaning: carelessness, arrogance, pride, mistakes

Four of Wands
dissatisfaction, kindness, reevaluation
Flipped meaning: new relationship, new ambitions, action

Five of Wands
lawsuit or quarrel, courage, competition
Flipped meaning: new opportunities, harmony, generosity

Six of Wands
leadership, good news, success
Flipped meaning: postponement, bad news, pride in riches

Seven of Wands
stiff competition, victory, courage, energy
Flipped meaning: advantage, patience, indecision

Eight of Wands
new ideas, love, journey
Flipped meaning: violence, quarrels, courage

Nine of Wands
victory, good health, obstinacy
Flipped meaning: weakness, ill-health, adversity

Ten of Wands
pain, ruined, failure
Flipped meaning: cleverness, energy, strength

Page of Wands
enthusiasm, exploration, discovery, free spirit
Flipped meaning: setbacks to new ideas, pessimism, lack of direction

Knight of Wands
generous, journey, impetuous
Flipped meaning: suspicion, jealousy, narrow-mindedness

Queen of Wands
fondness, attraction, command
Flipped meaning: jealous, revengeful, infidelity

King of Wands
passionate, good leader, noble
Flipped meaning: unyielding, prejudice, quarrels

Ace of Cups
good health, love, joy, beauty
Flipped meaning: egotism, selfishness, hesitancy

Two of Cups
romance, friendship, cooperation
Flipped meaning: violent passion, misunderstanding

Three of Cups
fortune, hospitality, discovery
Flipped meaning: hidden, overindulgence, pain, gossip

Four of Cups
dissatisfaction, kindness, reevaluation, redemption
Flipped meaning: new goals, ambitions, beginning

Five of Cups
broken marriage,vain regret, sorrow, loss
Flipped meaning: return, summon, hope

Six of Cups
acquaintance, good memories, acquaintance, happiness
Flipped meaning: friendship, disappointment, past

Seven of Cups
imagination, illusion, directionless
Flipped meaning: will-power, determination

Eight of Cups
disappointment, abandonment, misery
Flipped meaning: pleasure, success, joy

Nine of Cups
physical well-being, hopes, security
Flipped meaning: illness, failure, overindulgence

Ten of Cups
friendship, happiness, life
Flipped meaning: waste, broken relationships, quarrel

Page of Cups
sweetness, interest in literature, gentleness
poor imagination, selfishness, no desires

Knight of Cups
emotional, romantic dreamer, intelligence
Flipped meaning: idleness, untruthful, fraud, sensuality

Queen of Cups
loving mother, gentle, happiness
Flipped meaning: perverse, unhappy, gloom, over-active imagination

King of Cups
kindness, willingness, enjoyment
Flipped meaning: double-dealer, scandal, crafty, violent

Ace of Swords
love, valiant, victory
Flipped meaning: obstacles, tyranny, power

Two of Swords
indecision, trouble, balanced
Flipped meaning: unscrupulous, release

Three of Swords
broken relationship, civil war
Flipped meaning: sorrow, loss, confusion

Four of Swords
temporary exile, strife, retreat
Flipped meaning: social unrest, labor strikes, renewed activity

Five of Swords
defeat, cowardliness, empty victory
Flipped meaning: unfairness, defeat, loss

Six of Swords
harmony, sorrow, journey
Flipped meaning: obstacles, difficulties, defeat

Seven of Swords
betrayal, insolence, unwise attempt
Flipped meaning: counsel, helpful, advice

Eight of Swords
weakness, indecision, censure
Flipped meaning: freedom, new beginnings, relaxation

Nine of Swords
desolation, illness, suspicion, cruelty
Flipped meaning: unselfishness, good news, healing

Ten of Swords
defeat, failure, pain
Flipped meaning: courage, positive energy, good health

Page of Swords
grace, diplomacy, dexterity, grace
Flipped meaning: imposture, ill-health, cunningness

Knight of Swords
strong man, braver, clever person
Flipped meaning: troublemaker, a crafty, tyranny

Queen of Swords
skillful, brave, clever, rush
Flipped meaning: sly, keen, deceitful

King of Swords
powerful, friendship, counselor
Flipped meaning: obstinate, evil intentions, judgments

Ace of Pentacles
prosperity, happiness, pleasure
Flipped meaning: misery, greedy, money

Two of Pentacles
harmony, new projects, helpful
Flipped meaning: difficulty, discouragement

Three of Pentacles
abilities, approval, effort, abilities
Flipped meaning: preoccupation, ambitions

Four of Pentacles
ungenerous, greed, miserly
Flipped meaning: spendthrift, obstacles, earthy possessions

Five of Pentacles
destitution, poor health, despair, loneliness
Flipped meaning: employment, courage, revival

Six of Pentacles
prosperity, philanthropy, charity, gifts
Flipped meaning: jealousy, miserliness, unfairness

Seven of Pentacles
development, re-evaluation, effort, hard work
Flipped meaning: impatience, slow progress, investments

Eight of Pentacles
employment, money, learning, trade
Flipped meaning: void, no ambition, dislike

Nine of Pentacles
solitude, well-being, green thumb
Flipped meaning: caution, possible loss

Ten of Pentacles
wealth, property, stability
Flipped meaning: dull, slothfulness, misfortune

Page of Pentacles
kindness,new ideas/opinions, scholar
Flipped meaning: luxury, rebellious, bad news

Knight of Pentacles
dull outlook, patience, animal lover, trustworthy
Flipped meaning: carelessness, standstill, irresponsible

Queen of Pentacles
thoughtfulness, intelligence, talents, melancholy
Flipped meaning: mistrust, suspicion, neglect

King of Pentacles
reliable person, steadiness
Flipped meaning: bribes, materialistic, calm
